title: If Tyler1
body:
So, if I'm understand this correctly the summoner known as "Tyler01" got Unbanned after receiving a permaban.

Now I know this wont apply to every person, but I think it's just because he got enough publicity and became a meme. This wouldn't happen for every player who gets "Perma" Banned. I forgot when my account got permabanned but I believe it was back in February of this year. I'm just an unknown gold 5 player I don't stream I don't make youtube videos or anything like that But if Tyler can manage to prove he has 'Reformed' how would the average person be able to prove it? 

I understand I can just make a new account and during pre-season I might, I hadn't until now just because I wanted to take a break I wanted to cooldown and find a way to reform. I believe I have, but I have no way to prove it. I understand that a reformed player would be on thin ice either way, but if Tyler can do it, I want to be able to try and do it. Please Riot I know this probably wont get attention but how can I prove it.

replies.body:
Locking this thread since it's pretty old.

If you have any questions about this moderation, feel free to reach out to us in the [Boards Discord](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation/7rtKBZLi-boards-moderation-discord-verification).

> So, if I'm understand this correctly the summoner known as "Tyler01" got Unbanned after receiving a permaban.

Rumors. Memes. Pick your word.

Hey riot Tantram,

I always see you criticizing people for their toxic behavior, and commenting on some irrelevant nonsense like this Tyler propaganda.

When do you ever offer some crucial advice to help people reform. 

Do you want a better community, or just the thrill of banning people?

.......
Feel free to read through my post history. Click on my name and you can see them all.
Is there a source about perma-mutes never working before in the past? I've heard about it in certain permabanned threads, but never knew where they get the sources from.

It really breaks down into two categories.

1.) Helping players reform
2.) Shielding others from the behavior, at a cost.

We used to issue chat restrictions that essentially scaled indefinitely. 

We were able to determine that after a certain point the penalty no longer helped with reform. The 10-game and 25-game counts for chat restrictions are based on data that they were both light enough, and felt strict enough to encourage people to understand their behavior is unacceptable in game and change it.

We also saw that the players in this 'large restriction' category defaulted to gameplay altering means of harassing their team. It caused an increase in feeding and trolling.

The sample size of this population and time frame is huge. Essentially the time spanning from the introduction of chat restrictions to the introduction of IFS.

So my question for you is, would you rather have more feeders and less negative chat?

Defiantly feels like a biased experiment, 

No offence and I mean this in the most respectful way,

you should learn from Blizzard entertainment that has been around much longer in game infrastructure then riot games, and they issue a ban silence and it is very effective in HOTS(also have an option to disable chat at the start of the game, very effective). 

You and me both know that if someone is going to troll and with the intent of trolling, they will try to avoid chat to go as long as possible without getting detected. 

Anyways, it is your guys game and you shall do as you please, just one mans input.

Best of luck in your future endeavors.

Blizzard's history is with RTS and RPG dungeon crawlers, which cause different frustrations for players and result in different reactions. Get frustrated in any of Blizzard's older titles, you just quit and that's that. Your decision to quit was less negatively impactful to other players.

Blizzard's experience with MOBAs is less than that of Riot's. HotS has been around for 2 years. The Tribunal (and the old infinitely stacking chat bans) was around for 3 years. I believe the four tier system is older than HotS as well. While there are many ways to accomplish the same goal, it wouldn't surprise me if they have to change tactics with HotS at some point. Overwatch developers have commented that they've had to pause new features to work out their own behavior system, and you'd assume they'd have started with a foundation built from HotS.
The ban silence does nothing. They still troll...
Dude, Blizzard basically made a chat ban the default in HotS, you can't type anything the enemy team can ever see.

I'd rather altogether to be gone tbh. I always see to it that if someone can't control their fragile emotions after some certain period of time, might as well move themselves to another game. 

I'm not in support of perma-mutes, I just wanted to know where people get these info from. Thanks anyway for taking the brief time to explain it. I'll be pinning this in case for future references.

When my account was permabanned I had only got the 10 game chat restriction and 14-day ban. Not saying I didn't deserve the ban I did, but I have never heard of this 25 game chat restriction. So I guess I was so toxic back then that it went straight to 14 days. 

Question: Do you get one of the two 10 - 25 based around how toxic you are at the time before a 14?

> [{quoted}](name=Verbally Abusing,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=wsObUaFj,comment-id=000100010000000000000002,timestamp=2017-09-27T11:34:28.652+0000)
>
> When my account was permabanned I had only got the 10 game chat restriction and 14-day ban. Not saying I didn't deserve the ban I did, but I have never heard of this 25 game chat restriction. So I guess I was so toxic back then that it went straight to 14 days. 
> 
> Question: Do you get one of the two 10 - 25 based around how toxic you are at the time before a 14?

Depending on how bad you are, you may skip a tier or two.  Also using any type of hate speech always shoots you up to the 14 day ban.
I do believe your right when it comes to how bad a person is, but I know for a fact I never used racism or gender or other hate of speech words only normal verbal abuse.
The community stated multiple times that "muting & reporting" is the best solution. The problem is that **they still don't give a shit about it & still prefers talking back**.

Low-key don't want to write this in here but I see where you're a software engineer and I just want to know what your role is in the company like what you work on. The reason is I'm in college for game programming and just trying to learn about the industry from the workers.

I'm the tech lead of the Player Behavior team. Feel free to hit me up in game sometime and I'd be happy to chat engineering with you.

That summoner name does make me sad though :-).
Why not give a brief explanation to everyone? Why do you have to explain what you do in private messages?
This post is over 10 months old. Please take a glance at the date next time:)
That would be very helpful and friendly. I'm sorry for my name and the story behind, it is not fun either. But talking to you about programming and engineering would be very nice.
I see your Memes and raise you one Inexactness.

So he didnt get unbanned?

Dissapointing?
I have also been permabanned and would like to see an answer for this mans comment.
Tyler1 was never unbanned.

It's a bit of a misunderstanding about the difference between an account permaban and a player permaban.  Even if Tyler1 were to be allowed to play League again, his permanently suspended accounts would not be unbanned.  He would simply be allowed to make new ones.  

The best example of this that I can think of is C9 Jensen.  He was under a player permaban, but after a time, Riot did allow him to return to playing League.  At that time, he made new accounts.  None of his old accounts were unbanned.  

Player permabans are really quite rare.  It honestly takes quite a bit for Riot to decide that a PLAYER has become a detriment to the community to the point where they are to be banned upon sight.  For the average player, they will never encounter this.  Even players who end up with a handful of permabanned accounts don't generally cross into that territory.  It took 19 permabanned accounts and the thousands of copycat fanboys before Tyler1 reached that point, so it's not something that Riot does lightly.
Hes still banned...

He, uh...

He did not get unbanned...

Tyler1 got permabanned 24 times, and he's in a state where if he ever makes an account & plays it, Riot will just insta-ban it on sight.

Yours on the other hand is still a minor consequences. Your previous permabanned account will never be lifted, but you're still free to make a new one.

All I have to say about this is:
[http://na.op.gg/summoner/userName=t1t1t1t1t1](http://na.op.gg/summoner/userName=t1t1t1t1t1)

This is a Tyler1 account, has not been banned yet. As I understand it, his ban pertains only to him STREAMING league of legends, the accounts he uses to stream league with get permabanned, is that right?

He is most definitely banned entirely from playing. But the problem is that linking an account with one person beyond doubt is tricky unless he is caught streaming with that account. That's what makes it primarily and effectively a ban on streaming.

> [{quoted}](name=Cinder Lord Naru,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=wsObUaFj,comment-id=,timestamp=2017-09-27T02:17:46.007+0000)
>
> So, if I&#039;m understand this correctly the summoner known as &quot;Tyler01&quot; got Unbanned after receiving a permaban.
> 
> Now I know this wont apply to every person, but I think it&#039;s just because he got enough publicity and became a meme. This wouldn&#039;t happen for every player who gets &quot;Perma&quot; Banned. I forgot when my account got permabanned but I believe it was back in February of this year. I&#039;m just an unknown gold 5 player I don&#039;t stream I don&#039;t make youtube videos or anything like that But if Tyler can manage to prove he has &#039;Reformed&#039; how would the average person be able to prove it? 
> 
> I understand I can just make a new account and during pre-season I might, I hadn&#039;t until now just because I wanted to take a break I wanted to cooldown and find a way to reform. I believe I have, but I have no way to prove it. I understand that a reformed player would be on thin ice either way, but if Tyler can do it, I want to be able to try and do it. Please Riot I know this probably wont get attention but how can I prove it.

Tyler1 was banned from the game, the entire game, like when he makes a new account and is caught, banned.

You are banned from one account, but can make a new one. It won't get banned like how T1 is banned.

Is Tyler01 the same person as Tyler1? 

I mean no offense but isn't Tyler1 supposed to be good? Tyler01 has like 400+ games in ranked and is only silver.
No he's still banned.

Lol he is still banned and his ban wasn't just an account ban like yours. He has the rare player ban basic ban on site so even if they lifted that he would still have to start at level 1 and make a new account just like any other banned player

while i dont think it's fair to the average player you have to realize that tyler 1 has a promotional aspect to playing league. so i guess the answer is to become famous and offer something to sweeten the deal.
